channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 500 Migrants Feared Dead After Boat Sinks In Mediterranean
item.description: The International Migrant Organization says the incident took place last week when people smugglers rammed a vessel carrying hundreds of refugees hoping to reach European waters.
item.content:encoded:
The International Migrant Organization says the incident took place last week when people smugglers rammed a vessel carrying hundreds of refugees hoping to reach European waters.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: 'Nude' Or Not, Women's Cycling Team Uniform Makes Waves
item.description: Some observers called the outfits — which in photos seem to feature a swatch of flesh-tone-colored fabric in their lower region — "rude," "wrong" and a "disaster."
item.content:encoded:
Some observers called the outfits — which in photos seem to feature a swatch of flesh-tone-colored fabric in their lower region — "rude," "wrong" and a "disaster."

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: European Scientists Choose Site For Rosetta's Comet Touchdown
item.description: After a decade-long journey to reach Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko, the ESA says it has found the best spot for a planned November landing.
item.content:encoded:
After a decade-long journey to reach Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko, the ESA says it has found the best spot for a planned November landing.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Chinese Teacher Is Busted After Demanding Gifts From Students
item.description: In China's extremely competitive school system, families often buy presents for teachers. But a teacher has been suspended after she was caught on tape demanding gifts and insulting her students.
item.content:encoded:
In China's extremely competitive school system, families often buy presents for teachers. But a teacher has been suspended after she was caught on tape demanding gifts and insulting her students.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Mexican Resort Town Pummeled By Powerful Hurricane Odile
item.description: The Category 3 cyclone, the strongest on record to hit the region, slammed the tourist destination of Cabo San Lucas and will weaken as it moves up the Baja California peninsula, forecasters say.
item.content:encoded:
The Category 3 cyclone, the strongest on record to hit the region, slammed the tourist destination of Cabo San Lucas and will weaken as it moves up the Baja California peninsula, forecasters say.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Pistorius Could Still Compete For S. Africa In Olympics
item.description: Despite a conviction for culpable homicide and the looming possibility of a jail term, Oscar Pistorius would be free to compete, says the head of South Africa's Olympic committee.
item.content:encoded:
Despite a conviction for culpable homicide and the looming possibility of a jail term, Oscar Pistorius would be free to compete, says the head of South Africa's Olympic committee.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Renewed Fighting Threatens Truce In Eastern Ukraine
item.description: Pro-Russia separatists who control the city of Donetsk appear to have launched a push to take the city's airport, which is still defended by Kiev's forces.
item.content:encoded:
Pro-Russia separatists who control the city of Donetsk appear to have launched a push to take the city's airport, which is still defended by Kiev's forces.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Leaders Meet In Paris To Forge Fight Against Islamic State Militants
item.description: Representatives from more than 20 countries have gathered in the French capital to form a coalition to defeat the insurgency.
item.content:encoded:
Representatives from more than 20 countries have gathered in the French capital to form a coalition to defeat the insurgency.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Covering Up With The Hijab May Aid Women's Body Image
item.description: A few studies have found that modest clothing is connected with a healthier body image. So a British psychologist looked at whether the hijab protected women against the pressure to be thin.
item.content:encoded:
A few studies have found that modest clothing is connected with a healthier body image. So a British psychologist looked at whether the hijab protected women against the pressure to be thin.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Michaeleen Doucleff

item.title: More Allies Express Desire To Help Fight Against ISIS
item.description: Representatives of more than two dozen nations are in Paris, debating how to stop militants from the group the Islamic State. French President Francois Hollande says the group is a global threat.
item.content:encoded:
Representatives of more than two dozen nations are in Paris, debating how to stop militants from the group the Islamic State. French President Francois Hollande says the group is a global threat.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Deborah Amos

item.title: No Gas Guzzlers Here; Beijing Hosts First All-Electric Car Race
item.description: The very first Formula E all-electric car race took place over the weekend in Beijing. Promoters hope the 10-race series around the globe will boost sales of alternative fuel cars.
item.content:encoded:
The very first Formula E all-electric car race took place over the weekend in Beijing. Promoters hope the 10-race series around the globe will boost sales of alternative fuel cars.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Sierre Leone To Send Volunteers Out On Ebola Campaign
item.description: Officials are planning a three-day nationwide lockdown to help combat the outbreak. Audie Cornish talks to journalist Umaru Fofana about the volunteers the government wants to send door to door.
item.content:encoded:
Officials are planning a three-day nationwide lockdown to help combat the outbreak. Audie Cornish talks to journalist Umaru Fofana about the volunteers the government wants to send door to door.

» E-Mail This

item.title: The Streets Are Empty As The Shells Keep Falling In Eastern Ukraine
item.description: The precarious cease-fire is in danger of collapse after repeated violations by both sides. NPR's Eleanor Beardsley traveled through Donetsk as the shelling spread through residential neighborhoods.
item.content:encoded:
The precarious cease-fire is in danger of collapse after repeated violations by both sides. NPR's Eleanor Beardsley traveled through Donetsk as the shelling spread through residential neighborhoods.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Philip Morris Sues Uruguay Over Graphic Cigarette Packaging
item.description: The country requires photos of decaying teeth and gruesome hospital scenes on every pack. Philip Morris sees this as a violation of a trade agreement and is suing Uruguay for $25 million.
item.content:encoded:
The country requires photos of decaying teeth and gruesome hospital scenes on every pack. Philip Morris sees this as a violation of a trade agreement and is suing Uruguay for $25 million.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Tensions In Ukraine Increase As Cease-Fire Appears To Have Dissolved
item.description: A week-old ceasefire in eastern Ukraine has all but broken down. Shelling that was previously constrained to the airport in Donetsk reached the city over the weekend.
item.content:encoded:
A week-old ceasefire in eastern Ukraine has all but broken down. Shelling that was previously constrained to the airport in Donetsk reached the city over the weekend.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley
